channel.title: King is now at mercy of court
channel.description: What the hell did you do to the king?! He is now 99% useless....except for that ONE time he gets to exe someone....Now, as king, you get to listen to a hundred whispers, with NO WAY to confirm any info given to you yourself. I have over 100 hours playing up until this patch, but nerfing the king, the ruler of the fucking realm, was a lame and bad move. Like many of my friends, I will check back after you fix this travesty.

item.title: King is now at mercy of court
item.dc:creator: Bart_Auringer
item.description:
Yeah there is no counter claim to King calling you out.

You can say you’re framed, but no one will ever buy that given just the statistical odds of it, nor should they.

And even an evil king isn’t likely to fake a claim like that since they’ll die for it.

item.title: King is now at mercy of court
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Yeah, I also massively hated the reversal of it. I always enjoy the contest of claims in these games, you are accused, you go up, you put up your logs, demand your accuser put up his so people can compare which one seems more credible… everyone second guesses whether the accuser is a scorned, unseen etc…

Or you get put up by the king… you know normally in these kinds of games it’s considered gamethrowing not to put up a defence, but if you are accused by the king, there’s really no point in that formality. It doesn’t matter what your logbook says, or your claim. You are getting executed, end of discussion.

item.title: King is now at mercy of court
item.dc:creator: chawklette
item.description:
I think the new king feels good. Being able to instantly reveal a player’s faction is simply too big of a decisive investigation ability. It leads to some really unfun situations where a random check on night 1-4 gets you executed as an alchemist or a scorned BD or something.

Now the king doesn’t have decisive investigation abilities and actually has to rely on the court mostly for information. Allies isn’t completely useless though, since common claims for scum are often princess/drunk that you can easily find out if they’re lying. The new allies requires players to work together to socially deduce baddies instead of just getting a lucky check. Or it can outright help an evil king find a suspected prince.

I’d be fine with buffing it a bit since finding royalty isn’t that useful at all, but not putting it back where it was last patch.

item.dc:creator: danny135
item.description:
I understand why the king change was made, but I feel like the nerf was too harsh. There’s not really any reason to keep the original king now. Why should knights guard him or healers heal him if he could be any faction and he can’t really do anything aside from force a vote once. The meta I see is killing king and just letting the neutral killer take his place to make it easy for him and the BD. Or just killing king and letting a confirmed BD take his place. What can king even do? Prince and other investigative classes can just carry the game.

item.title: King is now at mercy of court
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
I gotta say completely the oposite here. To me the key to social deduction games was always the contest of claims for the accuser/accused. IE, is the accuser legitimate, scorned? Cult? Fool? NK trying to act like a scorned?

When the accuser is king, all of that is taken off the table. OK maybe he’s evil king, but even an evil king wouldn’t want to look evil early game, so that’s off the table. There’s no social deduction at all, if you are one of the first 4 checked, and you aren’t BD, you die… no if’s ands or buts. To me that is kind of pure luck, with no social deduction whatsoever.
